mechanoreception.notes: As marine mollusks, Entalinidae likely possess mechanoreceptors for sensing touch and vibration in their environment. This is inferred due to their lifestyle and evolutionary relationship to other mollusks.

chemoreception.notes: Marine mollusks typically rely on chemoreception to detect food and potential mates. It is inferred they have chemoreceptors.

vision.notes: The presence or absence of vision in Entalinidae is currently unknown.
